title: Formation peculiarities of radiation-induced aberrations of chromosomes in human cells under the modifying influence of chemical agents (comparative aspects).
abstract: Meta. Vyznachyty ta provesty porivnjal'nyj analiz chastoty ta spektru indukovanyh aberacij hromosom v kul'turi limfocytiv peryferychnoi' krovi ljudyny za umov kombinovanoi' dii' oprominennja z ko-mutagenom ta himichnym mutagenom Materialy ta metody doslidzhennja. Test-systema kul'tury limfocytiv peryferychnoi' krovi umovno zdorovyh donoriv z metafaznym analizom aberacij hromosom. Rezul'taty. Vyjavleno ko-mutagennyj efekt preparatu verapamil pry testujuchomu ?-oprominenni limfocytiv peryferychnoi' krovi ljudyny v diapazoni doz 0,3–2,0 Gr za rahunok pidvyshhennja chastoty aberacij hromosomnogo typu (dycentrykiv). Kombinovana dija ?-oprominennja ta nitrozovanogo glutationu sprjamovana na indukciju ta zberezhennja markeriv himichnoi' dii' – aberacij hromatydnogo typu. Vysnovky. Na hromosomnomu rivni limfocytiv peryferychnoi' krovi ljudyny vyjavleno ko-mutagennyj efekt preparatu verapamil za dii' malyh doz ?-oprominennja – pidvyshhennja chastoty aberacij hromosomnogo typu (promenevyh markeriv) u 2 razy ta javyshhe synergizmu za umov kombinovanoi' dii' malyh doz ?-oprominennja ta mutagenu nitrozovanogo glutationu – pidvyshhennja chastoty aberacij hromatydnogo typu (himichnyh markeriv) v ~3 razy.The study objective was to determine and provide a comparative analysis of frequency and spectrum of the induced aberrations of chromosomes in culture of the human peripheral blood lymphocytes under the combined impact of radiation, co-mutagen, and chemical mutagen.Culture of human peripheral blood lymphocytes and cytogenetic methods have been used.A co-mutagenic effect of the drug verapamil was established under the testing ?-irradiation of human peripheral blood lymphocytes in the dose range of 0.3-2.0 Gy at the expense of increased frequency of chromosomal aberrations (dicentrics). The combined effect of ?-irradiation and S-Nitrosoglutathione is directed on the induction and storage of chemical markers of exposure - the chromatid-type aberrations.A co-mutagenic effect of verapamil under the low-dose ?-irradiation as a 2-fold increase of the chromosome-type aberrations (radiation markers) incidence was revealed at a chromosomal level in human peripheral blood lymphocytes. Phenomenon of synergism of low-dose ?-irradiation and mutagen S-Nitrosoglutathione as a ~3-fold increased frequency of chromatid-type aberrations (chemical markers) was detected compared to the sole radiation effect.
